title: Saudis Find Sympathetic U.S. Ears at ‘Davos in the Desert’
description: A Saudi decision to support a cut in oil output infuriated Washington. But at an investment conference in Riyadh, there was plenty of praise for the kingdom.
dc:creator: Kate Kelly and Vivian Nereim
category: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
Abdulaziz bin Salman, Prince of Saudi Arabia
media:credit: Tamir Kalifa for The New York Times
media:description: The conference has become a magnet for business leaders, drawing more than 5,000 attendees this year alone.
